page.title: 05THE HISTORY OF PIPPBROOK.
page.content: The Pippbrook estate covered a piece of ground bounded on the north by the stream on the east by Fosterwood,on the south by the King's Highway from Reigate to Dorking,on the west it is now London Road. Around 1750 the main portion of the estate was back in one holding and from then on to the present day it was known as 'Pippbrook'. William Page pulled down the existing house and built a new one in the then modern style arcitechture 1758/9. In 1891 Mr.Thomas Aggs of Clapham Common paid Â£12,000 for the house and grounds with furniture valued at Â£330. On the 18th December 1930,it was aquired by the Dorking Urban Disrict Council.Pippbrook became the headquarters of the council until the property was transferred to the newly formed Mole Valley District Council on
